results.title: Operation skilltest
results.creator_credit: Robert Walker, Peter Johnson, Australia. Army. Director of Army Recruiting and Film Australia
results.brief_description: An army recruiting film showing something of the training for over 500 separate skills necessary to keep the Australian Army at peak efficiency and flexibility including truck driving, parachute packing and boat skills.

results.title: Operation G.A.T.E.
results.creator_credit: Don Virgo, Desmond Dew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film tells the fascinating story of one project in the long-range Global Atmospheric Research Program (GARP) intended to extend the time, the range and the accuracy of weather forecasting. The film centers on the activities of the sophisticated Canadian weather ship Quadra, anchored some 3000 kilometers off the west coast of Africa during Operation GATE (the GARP Atlantic Tropical Experiment), the largest international weather study ever undertaken. Elsewhere in the world, the film examines the activities of land, aircraft and satellite weather stations.

results.title: Open window
results.creator_credit: Richard Patterson, American Film Institute and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Based on a story by Saki. Frampton Nuttle is a nervous, irresolute character. He retreats from closing a draughty window when Vera appears, twitches and trembles as she tells of the death of uncles, and retreats at the sight of these supposedly dead men suddenly arriving through open windows. Cast includes Britt Leach, Cindy Eilbacher, Mary Wicks, Roslie Williams, Alan Caillou, William Beckley. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Operation Barbarossa
results.creator_credit: Peter Batty and Peter Batty Productions
results.brief_description: It was the biggest, bloodiest, bitterest battle ever fought. It cost the lives of at least 20 million people and ended Europe’s dominance in world affairs. It was the head-on clash of the two mightiest armies Man has ever known - and in sheer numbers, miles of front, and quantity of guns and shells and tanks, no other battle in history can compare with it. Unique archival material is combined with notable contributions from some of the participants, such as Albert Speer to document Hitler’s doomed attempt to subdue Russia.

results.title: Open city = Rome, open city = Roma, citta aperta
results.brief_description: Alongside de Sica’s “The Bicycle Thieves”, this film is the definitive work of Italian neo-realist cinema. “Rome Open City” follows the activities of the Resistance in the last days of the German Occupation. Many of the cast were active in the Resistance and the filming was done on street locations in Rome immediately after the Liberation. Rossellini spoke of wishing to “capture the fleeting reflection of appearances … All the action is seen from the outside, objectively”. In this feature he laid the ground rules for neo-realism: non-professional actors, hand held film-work, non-studio sets. The result is a film of uncompromising commitment to detailing the struggles of ordinary people to make sense of their everyday lives amid the brutality of war. In hindsight, some of the narrative might appear sentimental. The attempt by neo-realists to create an “objective cinema” was never to be fully achieved: the authorial voices of director and script-writer were to remain crucial in defining reality. But Rosselini’s film still manages, decades on, to convey the textures, sounds and sights of war and human endurance: some of the images remain unforgettable. Co-scripted by a young Federico Fellini.

results.title: Operating under pressure
results.creator_credit: John Richardson, Kestrel Films (Australia) and Victorian Pipelines Commission
results.brief_description: Construction of the 108-mile pipeline conveying natural gas from Dutson to Dandenong, Victoria. Shows manufacture, welding, testing and laying pipes, discussing problems encountered, and the final turning on of gas.

results.title: Opera school
results.creator_credit: Gudrun Parker, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Shows how a young singer during three years at the opera school of the Royal Conservatory of Music, Toronto, prepares for an operatic career. The film follows the progress of Marie Burton (played by Marguerite Gignac) from the time she first appears for audition until she rises to a leading role in the annual opera festival. The enthusiastic dedication to music by the youghful aspirants is caught by the camera, in school and out. Excerpts from operas are heard throughout the film, and the final section presents part of a full-dress performance of Mozart’s “The Marriage of Figaro” in English.

results.title: Op hop, op hop
results.creator_credit: Pierre Heberrt and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A hand-made, scratched-on film experiment in intermittent animation. The images are a group of twenty-four visuals, all non-representational, which arrange and rearrange on the screen in many combinations. The result is a changing pattern of sound and image that has its own rhythm for eye and ear.

results.title: Opera favourites with Placido Domingo and Kiri Te Kanawa
results.brief_description: Te Kanawa and Domingo are two names which rank amongst the most illustious in the world of opera. Both singers bring consummate skill and artistry to their individual performances, but together they form a partnership which is perfectly balanced, achieving a musical and dramatic rapport. All the exceptional musical and dramatic qualities Te Kanawa and Domingo command can be seen and heard in these magnificent performances. Selections are from; Die Fledermaus, The tales of Hoffmann, Agnes Baltsa, La faniciulladel West, Otello, Ernani, Manon Lescaut.
